caption:
The image features a close-up of a potted plant, particularly focusing on its foliage, which exhibits signs of pest or disease infestation. This plant, which appears to be housed in a small, round black pot, has vibrant green leaves that are substantially covered with white speckled markings. A few leaves show signs of curling or wilting, which might indicate poor health or a response to the infestation.

The plant is placed on what seems to be a wooden surface, possibly a table or bench, with a vague, indistinct background that suggests an indoor setting or a greenhouse, given the soft-focus view of additional wooden surfaces in the deep background. The setting, combined with the condition of the plant, may suggest a cultivation or a recovery effort to deal with the health of the plant. A narrow wooden stake or marker is barely visible at the back of the pot, potentially used for support or identification purposes. The overall appearance of the photo conveys a natural yet somewhat unkempt botanical environment.
title: "Smog-damaged" petunia at the Statewide Air Pollution Research Center
